pages.subtitle: Your complete guide to stand-up shows, improv nights, and comedy events in the Port City
pages.metaDescription: Find the best comedy events in Wilmington, NC. Weekly shows at Dead Crow Comedy Room, touring comedians, improv nights, and local showcases. Updated weekly.
pages.keywords: comedy events Wilmington NC, Wilmington comedy shows, stand-up comedy Wilmington, comedy night Wilmington, things to do Wilmington NC
pages.content:
Wilmington's Thriving Comedy Scene

Wilmington, North Carolina has become a hotspot for live comedy on the East Coast. Whether you're looking for nationally touring headliners, local stand-up showcases, or spontaneous improv performances, the Port City delivers laughs every night of the week.

Where to Find Comedy Events

Dead Crow Comedy Room

Wilmington's only dedicated comedy club hosts shows Thursday through Saturday, featuring touring comedians and local talent. Located at 511 N. 3rd Street in downtown Wilmington, Dead Crow is the heart of the local comedy scene.

Dead Crow Comedy Room

511 N. 3rd Street, Wilmington NC

View Schedule

Upcoming Events

Check the main Wilmington Laughs calendar for this week's shows, including ticket links and pricing information.

pages.title: Open Mic Comedy in Wilmington NC
pages.h1: Open Mic Comedy Nights in Wilmington
pages.subtitle: Free stage time for comedians every night of the week
pages.metaDescription: Complete guide to comedy open mics in Wilmington, NC. Free open mics Monday through Thursday at Dead Crow, Barzarre, Laws & Libations, and more venues.
pages.keywords: open mic Wilmington NC, comedy open mic, stand-up open mic Wilmington, free comedy Wilmington, Dead Crow open mic
pages.content:
Open Mic Comedy in Wilmington

Wilmington has one of the most active open mic scenes on the East Coast. With free open mics available almost every night of the week, aspiring comedians can find plenty of stage time to develop their material.

Weekly Open Mic Schedule

DayVenueTimeSign-up
MondayBarzarre (Castle St)6:30 PMFirst come, first served
TuesdayPort City Cheesesteak8:00 PMSign up at venue
WednesdayLaws & Libations7:00 PMSign up at venue
ThursdayDead Crow Comedy Room8:30 PMSign-up starts 7 PM
ThursdayLaws & Libations (Women of Wilmington)8:00 PMContact organizers

Tips for Your First Open Mic

  • Arrive early - Sign-up spots fill quickly, especially at Dead Crow
  • Prepare 3-5 minutes of material - Most mics give new comics 3-5 minutes
  • Bring a notebook - Write down what works and what doesn't
  • Be supportive - Stay and watch other performers
  • Have fun - Everyone bombs sometimes. It's part of learning!

The Best Open Mic for Beginners

If it's your first time, we recommend starting at Barzarre's Monday Open Mic. It's a supportive, low-pressure environment perfect for trying out new material. For a more club-like experience, Dead Crow's Thursday open mic is the place to be.

pages.title: Improv Classes in Wilmington NC
pages.subtitle: Learn improv from Wilmington's top comedy instructors
pages.metaDescription: Take improv classes in Wilmington, NC with DareDevil Improv. Beginner to advanced levels, kids classes, and sketch writing. Graduate to perform at Dead Crow Comedy Room.
pages.keywords: improv classes Wilmington NC, improv comedy Wilmington, DareDevil Improv, learn improv Wilmington, comedy classes Wilmington
pages.content:
Learn Improv in Wilmington

Whether you want to perform on stage, improve your public speaking, or just have fun, Wilmington's improv classes offer something for everyone. DareDevil Improv runs the most comprehensive curriculum in the area.

DareDevil Improv Classes

Improv 101 - Foundations

Perfect for beginners! Learn the fundamentals of "yes, and," listening, and scene work. This 6-week course covers everything you need to start your improv journey.

  • Duration: 6 weeks
  • Price: ~$225
  • No experience required

Improv 201-404 - Advanced Levels

Continue your training through advanced scene work, long-form improv, and performance techniques. Each level builds on the previous, culminating in performances at Dead Crow Comedy Room.

DareDevil Improv

Classes held at various Wilmington locations

View Class Schedule

Why Take Improv Classes?

  • Build confidence - Get comfortable speaking in front of groups
  • Improve listening skills - Learn to be present and react in the moment
  • Make friends - Join Wilmington's creative comedy community
  • Have fun! - Improv is a blast, even for non-performers

Kids Improv Workshops

DareDevil also offers workshops for young performers! Build creativity, confidence, and communication skills through games and exercises designed for children.

pages.title: Stand-Up Comedy Classes in Wilmington NC
pages.subtitle: Learn to write and perform stand-up with award-winning instructors
pages.metaDescription: Take stand-up comedy classes in Wilmington, NC. Learn from Nancy Witter's 'Look Who's Standing Up!' course at Dead Crow Comedy Room. Write, perform, and graduate with a showcase.
pages.keywords: stand-up comedy classes Wilmington NC, learn stand-up Wilmington, Nancy Witter comedy class, Dead Crow comedy classes, comedy writing Wilmington
pages.content:
Learn Stand-Up Comedy in Wilmington

Ready to try stand-up? Wilmington offers hands-on classes where you'll learn joke writing, stage presence, and timing from experienced comedians who've performed across the country.

Look Who's Standing Up!

Taught by award-winning comedian Nancy Witter, this multi-week course at Dead Crow Comedy Room takes you from concept to stage. You'll learn:

  • How to find your comedic voice
  • Joke structure and writing techniques
  • Stage presence and microphone skills
  • Timing, callbacks, and crowd work basics

The course culminates in a graduation showcase where you'll perform your material for a live audience!

About Nancy Witter

MAC Award winner and Nick at Nite Stand-Up Showdown finalist. Nancy has been teaching comedy in Wilmington for years, helping dozens of students find their voice on stage.

Learn More

What to Expect

  1. Week 1-2: Finding material and writing your first jokes
  2. Week 3-4: Refining material and learning stage craft
  3. Week 5-6: Practice performances and feedback
  4. Graduation: Perform your set at Dead Crow!

After the Class

Once you've graduated, Wilmington has plenty of open mics to keep practicing. Many class alumni become regulars at Dead Crow's Thursday open mic and eventually start booking paid gigs around town.

pages.title: Comedy Venues in Wilmington NC
pages.subtitle: Where to see live comedy in the Port City
pages.metaDescription: Guide to comedy venues in Wilmington, NC. Dead Crow Comedy Room, Laws & Libations, Barzarre, Waterline Brewing, and more places to catch live stand-up and improv.
pages.keywords: comedy venues Wilmington NC, Dead Crow Comedy Room, Wilmington comedy clubs, where to see comedy Wilmington, live comedy Wilmington
pages.content:
Wilmington's Comedy Venues

From dedicated comedy clubs to bars hosting weekly open mics, Wilmington has plenty of places to catch live laughs. Here's your guide to every venue in the Port City comedy scene.

Dead Crow Comedy Room

Wilmington's only full-time comedy club, Dead Crow is the heart of the local scene. National touring headliners perform Thursday through Saturday, with improv and open mics earlier in the week.

Dead Crow Comedy Room

511 N. 3rd Street, Downtown Wilmington

Shows: Wed-Sat | Tickets: $10-$30+

Get Tickets

Laws & Libations

This downtown bar hosts two weekly comedy events: Wednesday open mics and the Thursday Women of Wilmington showcase, featuring all-female stand-up performers.

Laws & Libations

108 Grace Street, Downtown

Shows: Wed & Thu | FREE

Barzarre

Formerly the Juggling Gypsy, this "unusual bar" on Castle Street hosts the longest-running Monday open mic in Wilmington. A laid-back atmosphere perfect for trying new material.

Barzarre

1610 Castle Street

Open Mic: Mondays 6:30 PM | FREE

Website

Other Venues

  • Waterline Brewing - Home of Gruff Goat Comedy showcases
  • Port City Cheesesteak Co. - Tuesday night open mics downtown
  • Wilson Center - Major touring acts (Leanne Morgan, etc.)

pages.title: Things to Do in Wilmington NC - Live Comedy Shows
pages.h1: Things to Do in Wilmington NC: Live Comedy
pages.subtitle: Looking for entertainment in the Port City? Catch a comedy show!
pages.metaDescription: Looking for things to do in Wilmington, NC? Catch live stand-up comedy and improv shows at Dead Crow Comedy Room. Date night ideas, weekend entertainment, and more.
pages.keywords: things to do Wilmington NC, Wilmington entertainment, date night Wilmington, weekend activities Wilmington NC, Wilmington nightlife
pages.content:
Comedy: Wilmington's Best Entertainment

Whether you're a local looking for weekend plans or a visitor exploring the Port City, live comedy is one of Wilmington's best-kept secrets. With shows almost every night of the week, you'll always find something to laugh about.

Date Night Ideas

Skip the movie theater and experience something unique! A comedy show is the perfect date night:

  • Intimate venue - Dead Crow seats about 100, so every seat is a good one
  • Shared experience - Laughing together creates connection
  • Dinner options nearby - Downtown Wilmington has great restaurants within walking distance
  • Affordable - Most shows are $10-$25 per person

Weekend Entertainment Schedule

DayShowTimePrice
WednesdayImprov Night8:30 PMFREE
ThursdayOpen Mic + Headliner8:30 PM$10
FridayHeadliner Shows7:00 & 9:30 PM$15-30
SaturdayHeadliner Shows7:00 & 9:30 PM$15-30

Dead Crow Comedy Room

511 N. 3rd Street, Downtown Wilmington

Get Tickets

Beyond the Club

Comedy happens all over Wilmington! Check out free open mics at local bars, special events at Waterline Brewing, and major touring acts at the Wilson Center.

pages.title: Date Night Ideas Wilmington NC - Comedy Shows
pages.h1: Best Date Night in Wilmington: Comedy Shows
pages.subtitle: Dinner and a show? Make it dinner and laughs at Dead Crow Comedy Room
pages.metaDescription: Plan the perfect date night in Wilmington, NC. Comedy shows at Dead Crow Comedy Room plus dinner at nearby downtown restaurants. Unique date ideas that aren't boring.
pages.keywords: date night Wilmington NC, romantic things to do Wilmington, unique date ideas Wilmington, comedy date night, Dead Crow date night
pages.content:
Why Comedy Makes the Perfect Date

Tired of the same dinner-and-a-movie routine? A comedy show is the ideal date night - you'll laugh together, share a unique experience, and have plenty to talk about afterward.

Plan Your Evening

Step 1: Dinner Downtown

Dead Crow Comedy Room is right in the heart of downtown Wilmington. Grab dinner at one of these nearby spots before the show:

  • Boca Bay - Upscale Mediterranean (5 min walk)
  • Caprice Bistro - French cuisine (3 min walk)
  • Circa 1922 - Tapas and cocktails (5 min walk)
  • PinPoint - Farm-to-table (2 min walk)

Step 2: The Show

Arrive 15-20 minutes early to grab drinks and get good seats. Shows typically run 90 minutes to 2 hours. The bar serves beer, wine, and cocktails.

Pro Tip

Friday 7 PM shows tend to be more relaxed. Saturday late shows (9:30 PM) are more energetic and sometimes edgier.

Step 3: After the Show

The show usually ends around 10-10:30 PM - perfect time for a nightcap! Downtown bars are steps away.

This Week's Headliners

Check out who's performing at Dead Crow this weekend and book your tickets early - popular shows sell out!

pages.content:
About Dead Crow Comedy Room

Located at 511 N. 3rd Street in downtown Wilmington, Dead Crow Comedy Room is the Port City's only full-time comedy club. Since opening, it has become the home of Wilmington's comedy scene and a stop for nationally touring comedians.

Weekly Schedule

DayEventTimePrice
WednesdayDead Crow Improv Night8:30 PMFREE
ThursdayOpen Mic + Headliner8:30 PM$10
FridayWeekend Headliner7:00 & 9:30 PM$15-30
SaturdayWeekend Headliner7:00 & 9:30 PM$15-30

Getting There

Dead Crow Comedy Room

511 N. 3rd Street
Wilmington, NC 28401

Downtown, near the corner of 3rd and Red Cross

Official WebsiteGet Directions

What to Expect

  • Seating: First-come, first-served general admission
  • Drinks: Full bar with beer, wine, and cocktails
  • Age: 18+ (21+ for late shows)
  • Duration: Shows typically run 90 minutes to 2 hours

Parking

Street parking is available throughout downtown. The deck at Water Street is a short walk away.

Annual Events

Cape Fear Comedy Festival (May) - Multi-day festival with dozens of comedians
Port City's Top Comic (Summer) - Annual competition for local comedians

pages.title: Cape Fear Comedy Festival - Wilmington NC
pages.subtitle: Wilmington's annual celebration of comedy
pages.metaDescription: Cape Fear Comedy Festival in Wilmington, NC. Multi-day festival at Dead Crow Comedy Room featuring national headliners, local showcases, and Port City's Top Comic finals.
pages.keywords: Cape Fear Comedy Festival, Wilmington comedy festival, Port City Top Comic, Wilmington NC comedy, Dead Crow festival
pages.content:
Cape Fear Comedy Festival

Every May, Wilmington transforms into a comedy destination for the Cape Fear Comedy Festival. Hosted primarily at Dead Crow Comedy Room, the festival features multiple days of shows, workshops, and the finals of Port City's Top Comic competition.

What to Expect

  • National Headliners - Touring comedians you've seen on Netflix, Comedy Central, and late night
  • Local Showcases - The best of Wilmington's comedy scene
  • Port City's Top Comic Finals - Watch local comedians compete for the title
  • Improv & Sketch Shows - DareDevil Improv and special performances
  • Workshops - Learn from visiting pros

Port City's Top Comic

Running alongside the festival, the Port City's Top Comic competition crowns Wilmington's funniest comedian. Local and regional comics compete through preliminary rounds leading to the festival finals.

Cape Fear Comedy Festival

Held annually in May at Dead Crow Comedy Room and downtown Wilmington venues.

Festival Info

Past Performers

The festival has featured comedians including nationally touring headliners and rising stars from across the Southeast.

Get Involved

Want to perform at the festival? Watch for open submission calls in early spring, or get noticed at Dead Crow's open mics throughout the year.

pages.title: Learn Comedy in Wilmington NC - Classes & Workshops
pages.subtitle: Stand-up, improv, and sketch comedy classes for all skill levels
pages.metaDescription: Learn stand-up, improv, or sketch comedy in Wilmington, NC. Classes for beginners and advanced students. Graduate to perform at Dead Crow Comedy Room.
pages.keywords: learn comedy Wilmington, comedy workshops Wilmington NC, beginner comedy class, stand-up lessons, improv training Wilmington
pages.content:
Start Your Comedy Journey

Whether you want to become a stand-up comedian, improve your public speaking, or just have fun, Wilmington offers comedy training for every goal and skill level.

Types of Comedy Classes

Improv Comedy

DareDevil Improv offers a full curriculum from 101 to 404. No experience necessary to start - just bring an open mind and willingness to play.

  • 101: 6 weeks, ~$225
  • 201-404: 8 weeks each, ~$250
  • Graduates perform at Dead Crow Improv Night

Stand-Up Comedy

Look Who's Standing Up! taught by Nancy Witter covers joke writing, timing, and stage presence. Multi-week course culminating in a graduation showcase.

Sketch Writing

Learn to write comedy sketches from instructors trained at Groundlings and UCB.

Kids Programs

DareDevil offers improv workshops for young performers - great for building confidence and creativity.

Class Contacts

DareDevil Improv Classes
Nancy Witter Stand-Up Classes

After You Graduate

Wilmington has plenty of opportunities to practice:

  • Dead Crow Thursday Open Mic
  • Barzarre Monday Open Mic
  • Laws & Libations Wednesday Open Mic
  • DareDevil shows and jams

pages.title: Free Comedy Shows in Wilmington NC
pages.subtitle: Laugh without spending a dime - free open mics and improv every week
pages.metaDescription: Free comedy shows and open mics in Wilmington, NC. Wednesday improv at Dead Crow, open mics at Barzarre, Laws & Libations, and more. Free things to do in Wilmington.
pages.keywords: free comedy Wilmington NC, free things to do Wilmington, free open mic, free improv show, budget entertainment Wilmington
pages.content:
Comedy Doesn't Have to Cost a Thing

Wilmington has one of the best free comedy scenes anywhere. From open mics to improv shows, you can laugh every night of the week without spending a dime on tickets.

Free Weekly Shows

DayEventVenueTime
MondayOpen MicBarzarre6:30 PM
TuesdayComedy Open MicPort City Cheesesteak8:00 PM
WednesdayOpen MicLaws & Libations7:00 PM
WednesdayDead Crow Improv NightDead Crow8:30 PM
ThursdayWomen of WilmingtonLaws & Libations8:00 PM

Why Free Comedy is Great

  • See future stars - Many famous comedians started at open mics
  • Intimate atmosphere - Small venues mean you're close to the action
  • Support local talent - These comedians are your neighbors
  • Low-pressure entertainment - Come and go as you please

Pro Tip

Dead Crow's Wednesday Improv Night is completely free and features polished performers from DareDevil Improv. It's the best free show in town.

What to Know

While tickets are free, venues may have drink minimums or expect you to purchase from the bar. Budget for a drink or two to support the venue hosting free comedy.

pages.title: Wilmington NC Comedians - Local Stand-Up Comics
pages.subtitle: Meet the funny people who make the Port City laugh
pages.metaDescription: Guide to local comedians in Wilmington, NC. Cliff Cash, Nancy Witter, Wills Maxwell Jr., and more. Wilmington's stand-up comedy scene and local talent.
pages.keywords: Wilmington comedians, local comics Wilmington NC, stand-up comedians Wilmington, Cliff Cash, Nancy Witter comedian
pages.content:
Wilmington's Comedy Stars

The Port City has produced and nurtured some seriously funny people. From Netflix specials to late-night appearances, Wilmington comedians are making their mark.

Notable Wilmington Comedians

Cliff Cash

Wilmington native and Netflix Trial by Laughter winner. Cliff filmed his special "The Long Road" at Thalian Hall and continues to tour nationally while calling Wilmington home.

Nancy Witter

MAC Award winner and Nick at Nite Stand-Up Showdown finalist. Nancy not only performs but teaches the next generation through her "Look Who's Standing Up!" classes at Dead Crow.

Wills Maxwell Jr.

Named Port City's Top Comic 2019. Creator of "What Did We Miss?" and StandUp NBC Regional Finalist. Active in the local scene and beyond.

Timmy Sherrill

Known as "The Godfather" of Wilmington comedy. Former Nutt Street owner and Charleston Comedy Festival winner. A veteran who helped build the scene.

Lew Morgante

Runs Gruff Goat Comedy showcases at Waterline Brewing. Regular host at Dead Crow known for his crowd work.

Rising Stars

The open mic scene is full of rising talent: Carson Hennessey, Colleen O'Meara, Julia Desmond, Jack Nelson, Zack Burke, and many more grinding it out every week.

See Local Comics

The best way to catch local talent is at the Thursday open mic at Dead Crow or the Women of Wilmington showcase at Laws & Libations.
